json_schema_specifications.title: DensityInput
json_schema_specifications.description:
Parameters to be used with the following quantities:
`density` - `vibratingTubeDensimetry`
`density` - `molecularDynamicsSimulation`

formulation.title: Formulation
formulation.description: This is a formulation defining the Chemicals contained in the sample and their fraction in the total mixture.

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: This is the temperature of measuring cell. Unit: kelvin

SMILES.title: Smiles
SMILES.description: A SMILES string representing the chemical.

InChIKey.title: Inchikey
InChIKey.description: The hashed standard International Chemical Identifier of the chemical to ensure machine-readability.

FormulationComponent.title: FormulationComponent
FormulationComponent.description:
This class shall be used when referring to chemicals as a component in a formulation.
When assembling a formulation based on FormulationComponents, consider, that it
might be required to use the same fraction type for all the chemicals.

chemical.title: Chemical
chemical.description: The chemical, which shall be described as a component in a solution .

fraction.title: Fraction
fraction.description: The unitless fraction of the chemical in the total of the mixture.

fraction_type.title: Fraction Type
fraction_type.description: A string defining, what kind of a fraction is given in the formulation. This can be for example molar fractions, volume fractions, mass fractions,.... At the moment only molar fractions are supported.

run_info.title: Run Info
run_info.description: The information regarding the formulation and the internal reference, which is common for all data generated in this run of the method.

density.title: Density
density.description: The output generated for the density data.

conductivity.title: Conductivity
conductivity.description: The ouptut of conductivity measurements, which were run in parallel to the density measurement.

SMILES.title: Smiles
SMILES.description: A SMILES string representing the chemical.

InChIKey.title: Inchikey
InChIKey.description: The hashed standard International Chemical Identifier of the chemical to ensure machine-readability.

FormulationComponent.title: FormulationComponent
FormulationComponent.description:
This class shall be used when referring to chemicals as a component in a formulation.
When assembling a formulation based on FormulationComponents, consider, that it
might be required to use the same fraction type for all the chemicals.

chemical.title: Chemical
chemical.description: The chemical, which shall be described as a component in a solution .

fraction.title: Fraction
fraction.description: The unitless fraction of the chemical in the total of the mixture.

fraction_type.title: Fraction Type
fraction_type.description: A string defining, what kind of a fraction is given in the formulation. This can be for example molar fractions, volume fractions, mass fractions,.... At the moment only molar fractions are supported.

FormulationInfo.title: FormulationInfo
FormulationInfo.description:
Additional information about a formulation, which is relevant for documentation
purposes

name.title: Name
name.description: A human readable name of the formulation.

uuid.title: Uuid
uuid.description: A unique identifier assigned to this formulation in this run.

preparation_date.title: Preparation Date
preparation_date.description: The date when the formulation was prepared. For commercial formulations, the manufacturing date may be used.

batch.title: Batch
batch.description: A batch number for the formulation, if it is available.

ChemicalInfo.title: ChemicalInfo
ChemicalInfo.description:
Additional information about a chemical, which is relevant for documentation
purposes

name.title: Name
name.description: A human readable name of the chemical, to which this information is referring.

molar_mass.title: Molar Mass
molar_mass.description: The molar mass of the chemical and the correcponding uncertainty. This may be a measured quantity or a literature value. It is needed to convert between volumetric and molar ratios and this field serves to report the used value. Unit: gram / mole

density.title: Density
density.description: The density of the chemical and the correcponding uncertainty. This may be a measured quantity or a literature value. It is needed to convert between volumetric and molar ratios and this field serves to report the used value. Unit: centimeter ** 3 * gram

batch.title: Batch
batch.description: A batch number for the chemical used, if it is available.

manufacturer.title: Manufacturer
manufacturer.description: The manufacturer of the chemical, if it is available.

manufacturing_date.title: Manufacturing Date
manufacturing_date.description: The date when the chemical was manufactured.

RunInfo.title: RunInfo
RunInfo.description:
Metadata for a run of a method. This information may apply to all samples
processed in the respective run.

formulation.title: Formulation
formulation.description: This is a formulation defining the Chemicals contained in thesample and their fraction in the total mixture.

internal_reference.title: Internal Reference
internal_reference.description: This field is an internal ID identifying this run of the method. In experimental setups, this may reference to an ID of the sample.

formulation_info.title: Formulation Info
formulation_info.description: This is the metadata concerning the formulation relevant for documentation.

chemicals_info.title: Chemicals Info
chemicals_info.description: This is a dictionary of metadata of the chemicals relevant for documentation. The keys are InChIKeys of the chemicals contained in the formulation and the values are ChemicalInfo objects.

MethodMeta.title: MethodMeta
MethodMeta.description:
Additional information obtained from a method summarizing information, whether 
the method was successfully run and what the rating for the returned data is.

success.title: Success
success.description: This reports, if the method finished successfully.

rating.title: Rating
rating.description: This field serves to rate the quality of the result from the tenant side. It shall serve as a support for the recieving party upon evaluating the trustworthiness of the result. It shall range from 0 (lowest) to 5 (highest).

DensityOutput.title: DensityOutput
DensityOutput.description:
Results returned from the following quantities:
`density` - `vibratingTubeDensimetry`
`density` - `molecularDynamicsSimulation`

values.title: Values
values.description: The values determined for the density. Unit: gram / centimeter ** 3

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: This is the actual temperature of measuring cell. Unit: kelvin

meta.title: Meta
meta.description: This field provides information regarding the reliability of the reported data. E.g. the success of the method for this quantity and the rating of the data. This is for this specific quantity, because a single method could fail individually for different quantities. It is not included in the RunInfo as one run may generate data for different quantities, for which the methods may fail individually.

ConductivityOutput.title: ConductivityOutput
ConductivityOutput.description:
Results returned from the following quantities:
'conductivity' - 'twoElectrodeMeasuringCell'
'conductivity' - 'molecularDynamicsSimulation'

values.title: Values
values.description: The values determined for the conductivity. Unit: siemens / meter

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: This is the actual temperature of the measuring cell or used in a simulation. Unit: kelvin

meta.title: Meta
meta.description: This field provides information regarding the reliability of the reported data. E.g. the success of the method for this quantity and the rating of the data. This is for this specific quantity, because a single method could fail individually for different quantities. It is not included in the RunInfo as one run may generate data for different quantities, for which the methods may fail individually.
